subject: Investing
title: Recency Bias in Markets
description: A 60-second lesson on Recency Bias in Markets.

hook.text: After five great years, investors piled into stocks in 2007. After the crash, they fled to bonds in 2009.

buildup.text: Recency bias makes us assume recent trends will continue indefinitelyâ€”boom feels permanent.

discovery.text: Markets are cyclical. What just happened is often a poor predictor of what happens next.

twist.text: The best time to buy is often when the recent past looks terrifying, not thrilling.

climax.text: Sticking to a fixed rebalancing schedule overrides recency bias with consistent discipline.

punchline.text: The past quarter is not a crystal ball. Invest by plan, not by headline.
